original: Bergqvist, Gustaf Adolf, rådman, Göteborg, f. 26/10/88 i Brunskog, Värml. 1., av fabr. Nils B. o. Mathilda Persson. G. 20 m. Stina Helin. Barn: Bo f. 21, Nils-Olof 23, Ingrid Birgitta 28. — Stud:ex. i Karlstad 08, jur. kand. i Upps. 14. E. o. hovr:not. i Göta hovr. 14, tingstjg. 16, tf. rådm. o. magistr :sekr. i Luleå 17, e. o. not. i Gbgs rådhusr. 17, polisnot. där 22, assessor 25, rådm. sed. 35. Särsk. skiljedom. i arb :tvister sed. 37, ordf. i p’oli’skoll. f. Gbgs ’Stad sed. 42, i tax:nd sed. 22, i länsnykterh :ndn f. Gbgs o. Boh. 1. sed. 38, v. ordf. i Gbgs arb :lösh :komm. sed. 37, ordf. i Gbgs hyresnd 42 o. den centr. sjöfartsdelegationen 44, led. av styr. f. fören. Sv :es stadsdomare sed. 38, ordf. i Gbgs juristkl. sed. 46. RNO.
translated: Bergqvist, Gustaf Adolf, magistrate, Gothenburg, born on October 26th, 1888 in Brunskog, Värmland, first child of the factory owner Nils B. and Mathilda Persson. Married to Stina Helin in 1920. Children: Bo, born in 1921; Nils-Olof, born in 1923; Ingrid Birgitta, born in 1928. He passed his studentexamen (final high school examination) in Karlstad in 1908 and his law degree in Uppsala in 1914. He became a clerk at Göta hovrätt (appeals court) in 1914, and a district court clerk in 1916, acting magistrate and secretary of the magistracy in Luleå in 1917, extra clerk at Gothenburg City Hall in 1917, police clerk there in 1922, assessor in 1925, and magistrate in 1935. He was a special arbitrator in labor disputes since 1937, chairman of the police college in Gothenburg since 1942, and of the central shipping delegation in 1944. He was a member of the board of the Association of Swedish City Judges since 1938 and chairman of the Gothenburg bar association since 1946. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star.

memberOf.name: Gothenburg and Bohus County Abstinence Committee

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
